qas.question: During what years did the Crimean War take place?
On what date did the Ottoman empire issue foreign loans to deal with the cost of the war?
Roughly 200,000 individuals of what group left Crimea during the war?
Roughly 90% of what group were pushed from their homes or ethnically cleansed during the Caucasian Wars?
Where did Circassians settle to when leaving their homes in the Caucasus?

context: The Crimean War (<a0_0>1853–1856<a0_0/>) was part of a long-running contest between the major European powers for influence over territories of the declining Ottoman Empire. The financial burden of the war led the Ottoman state to issue foreign loans amounting to 5 million pounds sterling on <a1_0>4 August 1854<a1_0/>. The war caused an exodus of the <a2_0>Crimean Tatars<a2_0/>, about 200,000 of whom moved to the Ottoman Empire in continuing waves of emigration. Toward the end of the Caucasian Wars, 90% of the <a3_0>Circassians<a3_0/> were ethnically cleansed and exiled from their homelands in the Caucasus and fled to the Ottoman Empire, resulting in the settlement of 500,000 to 700,000 Circassians in <a4_0>Turkey<a4_0/>.[page needed] Some Circassian organisations give much higher numbers, totaling 1–1.5 million deported or killed.
